text:
I had Apache 1.3 - it worked perfectly with all languages I needed to work 
with. Now I installed Apache 2, made necessary changes in httpd.conf - but I 
couldn't get Latvian language (Windws-1257 code
page) working properly, unless I added AddDefaultCharset WINDOWS-1257. BUT - 
as soon as I did it, all Russian pages are also encoded by this CodePage. It 
doesn't matter that AutoSelect is active in IE6
View-->Encoding settings and page has embedded tag <META
HTTP-EQUIV="Content-Type" CONTENT="text/html; charset=windows-1251">. Charset 
is Baltic (Windows). If I select Cyrillic (Windows), page is reloaded 
correctly. But again - only until the next page or refresh, and again 
everything is back to Baltic (Windows).

Why Charset which is set in HTML page is being ignored???
creator: guntis@baznica.lv

text:
Sorry, Ithink I gave wrng Apache version. I am talking about the latest Apache 
version 2.0.47.
creator: guntis@baznica.lv

text:
Apache doesn't care about meta elements and the browser doesn't either if a HTTP
header is supplied. You have to configure the charset properly, e.g. by
extension. The default httpd.conf gives some examples.
Please ask in a user support forum
(<http://httpd.apache.org/docs-2.0/faq/support.html>) for further details.

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text: *** Bug 23264 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
The problem is that charset was configured properly. And on Apache 1.3 worked 
fine, but the same charset in Apache 2 was completely ignored... Unless it is 
specified as the default charset, in which case pages with other charsets are 
displayed crippled. For example, if I specify Baltic charset (Windows-1257) as 
default, Latvian language pages are displayed properly, but pages in Russian 
(Windows-1251) are displayed as cripple-crapple unreadable text. Or vice 
verse. It wasn't so on Apache 1.3, where there wasn't any default charset and 
charset specified in Meta tag was used to display page properly.
creator: guntis@baznica.lv

text:
AddDefaultCharset is not the only possibility to configure a charset (as the
default in the name may already imply). Please *do* use one of the support
forums mentioned above. This one here is for bug reports only.

Misconfigurations are not a bug.
creator: nd@perlig.de
